content: Hmmm... There have been volcanic eruptions and earthquakes throughout history. Changes in the weather? Well, SOME of us understand the science of climatology, and can recognize weather patterns being impacted by both natural cycles and the influence of pollution on global climate change. Every generation seems to think the one after it is losing all sense of morality. Midwives back in ancient times knew how to use natural herbs to cause abortion, so this is nothing new. Gay marriage? You're so worried about that? Try worrying about the 50% divorce rate, which is higher in the "Bible Belt" than in those ungodly Blue States. Diseases running rampant is a result of a crowded global population. It's basic epidemiology. When Europe of the dark ages got too crowded, the plague broke out, and 1/3 of the population died. The world didn't end, but plenty of people claimed it would. Corrupt governments... HAHA! That's funny. Governments have been corrupt ever since the first caveman clubbed his brother on the back of the head and took over the cave-clan. Economic distress? For the vast majority of history, most people lived in abject poverty. There have been recessions and depressions of economies in modern history, as well as famines and times of impoverishment throughout the past. Just because we've been dumb enough to let the markets go the way they've gone doesn't mean global apocalypse. Crime... crime... that caveman-and-club thing... yeah, there have been criminals throughout history. Nothing new. People have always lied, stolen, and murdered. I mean, hell, look at your own Bible, if you believe in that sort of thing - they needed to make rules against those things thousands of years ago, so clearly, we're not doing anything new. There just happen to be hundreds of times more people on the planet now than there used to be. The Jews didn't "establish a state." They were given a chunk of land by a group of western countries. The land had belonged to them hundreds of years ago, but was no longer theirs. And why the hell should the Jews believe even more myths? Don't they have enough of their own? And as far as people becoming dumber... you're finally right about one thing. Willful ignorance is becoming a common theme, illustrated perfectly by this church sign from a parish in Arkansas: And yes, that's a real church sign, not one from that church sign "generator" website. So... carry on with your "end time" rambling if you must. People have been ranting about the imminent "end times" for thousands of years. Must be any day now.

content: Hi Bill... No I don't think innocent lives should be taken or sacrificed at all, even in the name of religion. You are talking about the extreme fanatics that are found in all walks of life. Atheist have them also. People have the right to believe what they will, regardless of what we think they should, I can accept that and so do you probably. We are not the general managers of the world, even when we think (maybe even know) that we could do a better job in certain situations, like getting medical help that is available for someone. They have their rights and beliefs which I will honor, even when I don't understand them. Just like I do with you. I know a better way, that works for me and many others. If you think Christianity leads to death, that's your right. I know it leads to life. We can find examples on both sides of this fence. Phillippians 4:8 says it best. Thoughts become words, words become action, and action becomes direction. It is very important where our thoughts come from... We determine what we think. Which is the answer to your initial question. Christianity does not lead to death, man with his superior knowledge, lead by his thoughts and emotions do...

content: Hmmm... There have been volcanic eruptions and earthquakes throughout history. Changes in the weather? Well, SOME of us understand the science of climatology, and can recognize weather patterns being impacted by both natural cycles and the influence of pollution on global climate change. Every generation seems to think the one after it is losing all sense of morality. Midwives back in ancient times knew how to use natural herbs to cause abortion, so this is nothing new. Gay marriage? You're so worried about that? Try worrying about the 50% divorce rate, which is higher in the "Bible Belt" than in those ungodly Blue States. Diseases running rampant is a result of a crowded global population. It's basic epidemiology. When Europe of the dark ages got too crowded, the plague broke out, and 1/3 of the population died. The world didn't end, but plenty of people claimed it would. Corrupt governments... HAHA! That's funny. Governments have been corrupt ever since the first caveman clubbed his brother on the back of the head and took over the cave-clan. Economic distress? For the vast majority of history, most people lived in abject poverty. There have been recessions and depressions of economies in modern history, as well as famines and times of impoverishment throughout the past. Just because we've been dumb enough to let the markets go the way they've gone doesn't mean global apocalypse. Crime... crime... that caveman-and-club thing... yeah, there have been criminals throughout history. Nothing new. People have always lied, stolen, and murdered. I mean, hell, look at your own Bible, if you believe in that sort of thing - they needed to make rules against those things thousands of years ago, so clearly, we're not doing anything new. There just happen to be hundreds of times more people on the planet now than there used to be. The Jews didn't "establish a state." They were given a chunk of land by a group of western countries. The land had belonged to them hundreds of years ago, but was no longer theirs. And why the hell should the Jews believe even more myths? Don't they have enough of their own? And as far as people becoming dumber... you're finally right about one thing. Willful ignorance is becoming a common theme, illustrated perfectly by this church sign from a parish in Arkansas: And yes, that's a real church sign, not one from that church sign "generator" website. So... carry on with your "end time" rambling if you must. People have been ranting about the imminent "end times" for thousands of years. Must be any day now.

content: There are extremists in every possible facet of life, both religious and otherwise. I can assure you I’ve never read anywhere in the bible where Jesus said “Go and bring my message by force”. Yes there have been many misplaced Christians over time. Look at Westboro Baptist Church. I for one do not lump Muslims into the same category as the extremists who crashed into the WTC. There are a lot of Christians out there who misrepresent Gods word and the life of Jesus. If someone asked him to leave because they didn’t want to hear his message, he did. Being a Christian is a slippery slope. On one side you’re always tempted to sin, and sometimes you fail. Then you pick up the pieces and try again. Every Christian sets a bad example because everyone sins, including Christians. Everyone has their addictions and vices, including Christians. The point is to live your life the best you can and communicate with God through Jesus and pray for forgiveness.

content: Hmmm... There have been volcanic eruptions and earthquakes throughout history. Changes in the weather? Well, SOME of us understand the science of climatology, and can recognize weather patterns being impacted by both natural cycles and the influence of pollution on global climate change. Every generation seems to think the one after it is losing all sense of morality. Midwives back in ancient times knew how to use natural herbs to cause abortion, so this is nothing new. Gay marriage? You're so worried about that? Try worrying about the 50% divorce rate, which is higher in the "Bible Belt" than in those ungodly Blue States. Diseases running rampant is a result of a crowded global population. It's basic epidemiology. When Europe of the dark ages got too crowded, the plague broke out, and 1/3 of the population died. The world didn't end, but plenty of people claimed it would. Corrupt governments... HAHA! That's funny. Governments have been corrupt ever since the first caveman clubbed his brother on the back of the head and took over the cave-clan. Economic distress? For the vast majority of history, most people lived in abject poverty. There have been recessions and depressions of economies in modern history, as well as famines and times of impoverishment throughout the past. Just because we've been dumb enough to let the markets go the way they've gone doesn't mean global apocalypse. Crime... crime... that caveman-and-club thing... yeah, there have been criminals throughout history. Nothing new. People have always lied, stolen, and murdered. I mean, hell, look at your own Bible, if you believe in that sort of thing - they needed to make rules against those things thousands of years ago, so clearly, we're not doing anything new. There just happen to be hundreds of times more people on the planet now than there used to be. The Jews didn't "establish a state." They were given a chunk of land by a group of western countries. The land had belonged to them hundreds of years ago, but was no longer theirs. And why the hell should the Jews believe even more myths? Don't they have enough of their own? And as far as people becoming dumber... you're finally right about one thing. Willful ignorance is becoming a common theme, illustrated perfectly by this church sign from a parish in Arkansas: And yes, that's a real church sign, not one from that church sign "generator" website. So... carry on with your "end time" rambling if you must. People have been ranting about the imminent "end times" for thousands of years. Must be any day now.

And there is another side to the story of religion (which ever religion) and I don't mind spelling that out from time to time... many people appreciated hearing it. "Salvation" can work two ways. Besides, for me, it's not "most of my time".... though I do see others who seem to make a career out of posting on mil.com. But, perhaps they have nothing else to do.... at least they are being 'social'... sort of.

content: There are extremists in every possible facet of life, both religious and otherwise. I can assure you I’ve never read anywhere in the bible where Jesus said “Go and bring my message by force”. Yes there have been many misplaced Christians over time. Look at Westboro Baptist Church. Are you going to tell me that you lump them in with Christianity in general? Do you honestly believe that these people are trying to spread God’s word in the way God intended? I for one do not lump Muslims into the same category as the extremists who crashed into the WTC. There are a lot of Christians out there who misrepresent Gods word and the life of Jesus. Jesus’ life set the example for all Christians to follow and nowhere in there did he ever kill anyone one to deliver his message. If someone asked him to leave because they didn’t want to hear his message, he did. Being a Christian is a slippery slope. On one side you’re always tempted to sin, and sometimes you fail. Then you pick up the pieces and try again. Every Christian sets a bad example because everyone sins, including Christians. Everyone has their addictions and vices, including Christians. The point is to live your life the best you can and communicate with God through Jesus and pray for forgiveness.

content: Hi Bill... No I don't think innocent lives should be taken or sacrificed at all, even in the name of religion. You are talking about the extreme fanatics that are found in all walks of life. Atheist have them also. People have the right to believe what they will, regardless of what we think they should, I can accept that and so do you probably. We are not the general managers of the world, even when we think (maybe even know) that we could do a better job in certain situations, like getting medical help that is available for someone. They have their rights and beliefs which I will honor, even when I don't understand them. Just like I do with you. I know a better way, that works for me and many others. I disagree with your way and find through your understanding as explained by you, that you refuse to consider much, even though I find you very intelligent. OK, I accept that... You also have the right to your beliefs. I will agree that the bible is written with a slant to explain and lead people to God. It is not written to take people away, other books have been written for that. You have the ability to look and gather all information you can find against fellowship with God, that too, is your right and belief... I have the ability to do the opposite and find more reason to accept and follow Christian belief, which is my right. I'm not here to argue or change your opinion, that's not my job. My job is to be more Christ like every day... Bill, it's the hardest thing I've never accomplished, but I will continue. I have seen the difference it makes in my life and the lives of others. If you think Christianity leads to death, that's your right. I know it leads to life. We can find examples on both sides of this fence. Phillippians 4:8 says it best. Thoughts become words, words become action, and action becomes direction. It is very important where our thoughts come from... We determine what we think. Which is the answer to your initial question. Christianity does not lead to death, man with his superior knowledge, lead by his thoughts and emotions do...

content: quote: If you think Christianity leads to death, that's your right. On a peculiar level, I think Christianity is a death cult. The blood and body of the Eucharist, the wanting to be dead to join the maker in heaven, the killing of all who don't believe... all that. Creepy, when you're able to think about it clearly. Moderate Christianity enables those who actually do consider their murder and mayhem to be righteous in His name, just like moderate Islam does the same for its more vicious participants. If you're willing/able to consider it a cult of peace, more power to you. Don't think of smiting someone with a sharp cross. It wouldn't be a sin, but it would be against the law (non-religious definition of sin).
